adjectives.description: fuliginous (comparative more fuliginous, superlative most fuliginous)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to or resembling soot in such features as colour, texture or taste; sooty, dusky. [from 16th c.]
examples: …the fuliginous Matter form'd, by the Drift of the Air, into the Shape of a Species of marine Lichen, in Creeks of Chimneys, Stoves, Forges and Furnaces, where there are Fires kept for a considerable Time, and much Fuel spent.
